title: Fastest Inflation in 31 Years Puts More Heat on Washington
summary: The Consumer Price Index rose 6.2 percent in October from a year earlier, its sharpest increase since 1990. That is bad news for President Biden and the Federal Reserve.

title: Stocks Soar in India, Luring Investors at Home and Abroad
summary: The second-most populous country is enjoying some of the world’s strongest stock market returns. Pro-growth policies and gnawing questions about China have helped.

title: Can Hydrogen Save Aviation’s Fuel Challenges? It’s Got a Way to Go.
summary: Small, experimental hydrogen-powered planes are paving the way for net-zero carbon aviation by 2050. But the route is rocky.

title: Shell proposes a shift to Britain, dropping ‘Royal Dutch’ from its name.
summary: The restructuring is meant to make the company more appealing to investors and make it easier to sell assets, the oil giant said.

title: With Gas Prices High, Calls Grow to Tap Strategic Oil Reserve
summary: President Biden is under pressure to release oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. Here’s how it works, and how it might lower prices (modestly, and maybe not for long).

title: Oil output is catching up with demand, possibly easing prices, a report says.
summary: The International Energy Agency said in its monthly report that oil production was picking up in the United States.

title: Investors Hung Their Hats on Peloton and Zoom Last Year. What Now?
summary: Some “stay-at-home” stocks that were pandemic-era darlings have experienced brutal sell-offs.

title: Biden Highlights Electric Vehicles While Asking for Inquiry Into High Gas Prices
summary: The president asked the Federal Trade Commission to look into whether big oil companies were fueling a spike in gas prices.

title: Buy Stocks to Prosper. Buy Bonds to Sleep at Night.
summary: Do what it takes to stay invested in the stock market, our columnist says. Government bonds may help, even if they look unappealing now.

title: Family Unvisited, Travel a No-Go: The Hard Costs of High Gas Prices
summary: They hit their highest level since 2014 last month, forcing Americans to rejigger household budgets and forgo leisure activities.

title: The United States and other world powers will tap oil reserves.
summary: In an attempt to reduce energy prices, the U.S. will release 50 million barrels of crude. Five other nations also will dip into stockpiles.

title: As Inflation Surges, Pakistan Seeks a $6 Billion I.M.F. Lifeline
summary: Rising prices and a weakened currency are straining households, intensifying pressure on Prime Minister Imran Khan to find solutions.

title: Prices climbed in October at fastest pace in 30 years, the Fed’s preferred inflation gauge shows.
summary: Prices climbed by 5 percent in the 12 months through October, according to Personal Consumption Expenditures price index data released Wednesday.

title: Markets Tumble as New Coronavirus Variant Brings Travel Restrictions
summary: Stocks and oil futures slumped, while investors sought safety in government bonds.

title: The Week in Business: Choosing the Same Path
summary: President Biden opted for continuity at the Fed, nominating Jerome Powell to a second four-year term. And it’s that time of year — for travel and shopping.

title: An Auto Show for the Raddest Cars of the ’80s and ’90s
summary: Nostalgia mixes with tape decks and car phones at RADwood events that aim to capture “the essence of a bodacious era.”

title: Markets rise as investors reconsider the unknowns of the Omicron variant.
summary: After tumbling on Friday, the S&P 500 gained more than 1 percent. Oil prices and bond yields also rose.

title: Stocks fall again as the Fed signals it could end economic support sooner.
summary: The Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, said persistent inflation might require a more aggressive approach by the central bank. Wall Street was already uneasy.

title: Stocks and oil drop again, as Omicron’s arrival in the U.S. whips markets.
summary: Investors are considering the risk of a new variant of the coronavirus, and its potential impact on the global economy, and are grappling with a shifting outlook for interest rates.

title: OPEC Faces Omicron Uncertainty and Rebellious Customers
summary: The oil cartel and Russia want to bolster prices after a 10 percent drop last week. But they also need to consider the release of reserves by the U.S. and other countries.

title: Biden Projects Normalcy and Optimism as Omicron Poses New Threat
summary: The president tried to convey holiday cheer as he celebrated Hanukkah and downplayed virus concerns as the variant was detected in California.

title: OPEC stays on course with plans for a modest increase in oil production.
summary: The oil cartel and Russia met less than a week after crude prices plunged amid worries over the Omicron variant.

title: Stocks slide again after the jobs report sends mixed signals on the economy.
summary: The S&P 500 is down nearly 4 percent since Omicron first began to make headlines.

title: Is Private Equity Overrated?
summary: The strategy’s returns increasingly may not provide the stellar performance that investors have been sold.

title: The Week in Business: Uncertainty Over the New Virus Variant
summary: With much unknown about Omicron, President Biden announced travel restrictions and the stock market fell. Plus, the F.T.C. blocked a major chip deal.

title: U.S. Threat to Squeeze Russia’s Economy Is a Tactic With a Mixed Record
summary: Sanctions, like aiming to cut oil exports, could also hurt European allies. “It’s a limited toolbox,” one expert said.

title: How’s the Economy? Biden Sees a Boom. Many Americans Don’t.
summary: The president has struggled to sell strong growth and job gains to a public that appears more concerned about rising prices — and remains anxious about Covid.

title: Urbanites Flock to Atlantic Canada as Pandemic Blunts Cities’ Appeal
summary: As housing prices soar in big cities, the country’s eastern provinces are experiencing a surge in migration. Newcomers are being welcomed, but some locals are wary.

title: A Power Struggle Over Cobalt Rattles the Clean Energy Revolution
summary: The quest for Congo’s cobalt, which is vital for electric vehicles and the worldwide push against climate change, is caught in an international cycle of exploitation, greed and gamesmanship.

title: Race to the Future: What to Know About the Frantic Quest for Cobalt
summary: A New York Times investigation examines the global demand for raw materials as the clean energy revolution takes off. This is what we found.

title: How the U.S. Lost Ground to China in the Contest for Clean Energy
summary: Americans failed to safeguard decades of diplomatic and financial investments in Congo, where the world’s largest supply of cobalt is controlled by Chinese companies backed by Beijing.

title: New ‘Variant of Concern’ Fuels Global Fear of Another Virus Surge
summary: Scientists do not yet know how dangerous the new Omicron variant is, but its many mutations set off alarms, lowering hopes of putting the pandemic in the past.

title: Israel and Iran Broaden Cyberwar to Attack Civilian Targets
summary: Iranians couldn’t buy gas. Israelis found their intimate dating details posted online. The Iran-Israel shadow war is now hitting ordinary citizens.

title: Brazil’s President Lula Is Staging a Comeback. Can He Bring the Country Along?
summary: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, the former president, has beat back a flurry of corruption cases and climbed to the front of next year’s presidential race.

title: A Tale of Culinary Reconciliation, Beside the Eiffel Tower
summary: Two decades ago, Spain was the new France, leading gastronomic innovation. Now two iconic chefs have joined forces in Paris.

title: Hunt for the ‘Blood Diamond of Batteries’ Impedes Green Energy Push
summary: Dangerous mining conditions plague Congo, home to the world’s largest supply of cobalt, a key ingredient in electric cars. A leadership battle threatens reforms.

title: Sifting Through Mud, Flooded Canadians Fear Next Disaster
summary: Washed-out roads and destroyed bridges are just some of the devastation afflicting residents of the western province and could signal what climate change will bring in the future.

title: ‘Our Money Has No Value’: Frustration Rises in Turkey at Lira Crisis
summary: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s insistence on directing monetary policy and sticking with low interest rates is draining confidence, economists say.

title: On Syria’s Ruins, a Drug Empire Flourishes
summary: Powerful associates of Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, are making and selling captagon, an illegal amphetamine, creating a new narcostate on the Mediterranean.
